Portal, with its innovative physics and confusing perspectives, makes for some relaxing, but solid entertainment. The escape from Aperture was excellent and shouldâ€™ve been much longer.

8.5 / 10

I forgot how good this game was! I remember playing on the 360 and was happy to see I could replay it again when I got my pc. Graphics better than what they were on console and game play is very fun and clever. It's refreshing to play a puzzle game that bends the rules of normal game play. (If you are into this, the VR game A Fisherman's Tale is definitely worth checking out.)

Playing Portal, and going in completely blind for the first time, was an experience I wish I had the joy of doing a lot earlier than roughly 14 YEARS after its initial release. Of course I knew about Portal- everybody knows about Portal at this point, right? And itâ€™s always been on my mind as a potential gaming experience. Well this was finally Portalâ€™s time to shine; and wow did the game shine! 
I didnâ€™t expect a whole lot from Portal: challenges, sure! Robots, yeah! Recognisable quotes, bring â€˜em on! But I did not expect what the game actually delivered. Short as it may be, Portal was one heck of a FUN and puzzling experience, with well-crafted gameplay, incredibly witty and humorous dialogue and the longing for more Portal-like experiences! 
For anyone who still hasnâ€™t picked up the game even after 14 years (like me); if you even remotely consider trying Portal, DO IT! It was a great experience!
It's Portal, what more can I say :)
Game good

It's a good game, pretty fun! But it isn't worth $10 in my opinion. The games main story is too short and the game really shows its age. It feels more like a free game. It is a fun game to play for an hour or two though, give it a shot if you'd like!
